672: A. If we and you do not agree on the amount of loss, either may demand an appraisal of the loss. In this event, each party will select a com- petent appraiser. The two appraisers will select an umpire. The appraisers will state separately the actual cash value and the amount of loss. If they fail to agree, they will submit their dif- ferences to the umpire. A decision agreed to by any two will be binding. Each party will: 1. Pay its chosen appraiser; and 2. Bear the expenses of the appraisal and um- pire equally.
673: B. We do not waive any of our rights under this policy by agreeing to an appraisal.
